alert.note: Alert for Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 10:17AM AKST until January 15 at 10:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...LONG DURATION SNOW EVENT CONTINUING INTO THE NEW WORK WEEK... .As a system positions itself across the northern gulf, moisture is being steered into the Panhandle, with widespread precipitation enveloping the north and central areas. Warmer temperatures have penetrated inland, with many observation sites rising a few degrees by Monday afternoon. Expect snow ratios to continue drop as snow becomes wetter and heavier. As the front moves southeast Monday afternoon it will bring accumulating snowfall to the southern Panhandle. For the north, accumulating snowfall is expected to ramp up in the morning hours due to a slow moving frontal boundary. Along this front, as it moves south, expected the highest snowfall rates, upwards of 0.75 - 1.0 inches per hour. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches. * WHERE...Municipality of Skagway and Haines Borough and Klukwan. * WHEN...Until 10 PM AKST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snowfall accumulations expected between 9 am and 3 pm.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather. For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
